intro: Rapanea kwangsiensis var. tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan rapanea, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous forest ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically vulnerable species.
